text:
THE FLORIDA STATE UNIVERSITY
TALLAHASSEE 32306
UNIVERSITY BROADCASTING SERVICES
June 22, 1967
Mr. Jerrold Sandler
Executive Director
National Educational Radio
1346 Connecticut Avenue, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
Dear Jerry:
Here is some of the recent correspondence on the Broadcasting Act.
Note particularly Claude Pepper’s statement to the House, the headline
of which is admirable. Someone has apparently squelched his enthusiasm
for radio which we should perhaps revive.
One of my reasons for calling last week was to tell you that I’m not
trying to pull a ’’Doddism”, When I left the Kenwood Club I intended to
pay my bill by check since, as I told you, my expenses were being covered
here. But the clerk made me feel so bourgeois not just charging it I said,
why not? As soon as my reimbursement comes I’ll send you a check.
The Floyd Christian testimony is coming slowly. I hope to have some¬
thing to read to you after this weekend.
Peace!
Sincerely,
K__ „__lan
MN/je
